nodes.text: Crev Bombaasa was a well-cultivated human male who worked as a shipping executive on the planet Corellia. He bribed local law enforcement to stop them from investigating violent attacks against his business rivals, but faced greater scrutiny under the Galactic Empire. This prompted him to travel to Coronet Spaceport in order to leave Corellia in search of a new base of operations.

While in the spaceport he witnessed another traveler being arrested, which allowed the criminals Han and Qi'ra to cut in line behind Bombaasa. The executive then continued to move forward in the queue without incident.

Crev Bombaasa was a human male who worked as a shipping executive on the planet Corellia. He paid enormous amounts to the local police in order to ensure that they did not investigate violent strikes against his business rivals. During the reign of the Galactic Empire, his work became more difficult under Imperial scrutiny, and so in 13 BBY, he traveled to Coronet Spaceport in order to leave Corellia and begin scouting the Outer Rim Territories for a new location to set up his base of operations.

While in the spaceport, Bombaasa was stood in line waiting to pass through the Imperial checkpoint, when Imperial stormtroopers dragged away another human in the line behind him. Bombaasa turned to briefly to watch the commotion, before returning his attention to the front of the line as the criminals Han and Qi'ra used the confusion to cut into the space in the line behind him.

The line then proceeded forward without further incident until Bombaasa had been called up to the booth, after which the checkpoint was locked down when Qi'ra and Han attempted to bribe their way through. Travelers who had already passed through the checkpoint were prevented from leaving.
Crev Bombaasa was well-educated and had a refined taste in the arts. He had fair skin, brown eyes and brown hair.

While in the spaceport, Bombaasa wore a gray robe with a yellow collar under a black gaberwool overcloak with a pair of black boots. He carried a cane containing a location transponder and wore an elite-status transit tag.

Crev Bombaasa first appeared in the new Star Wars canon in the 2018 Anthology Series film, Solo: A Star Wars Story and was first identified in the accompanying reference book Solo: A Star Wars Story The Official Guide, which was written by Pablo Hidalgo. The character originated in the Star Wars Legends continuity, where he first appeared in The DarkStryder Campaign, a 1995 supplement to Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game published by West End Games.
